text: Add sugar and corn syrup to a small bowl. Mix together. Set aside. Place a medium bowl in the refrigerator to chill. When the bowl is cold, add the heavy cream. Whip the cream at low speed until it holds its shape.  Cover the bowl and return the softly whipped cream to the refrigerator.  Wash and hull the strawberries.  Puree the strawberries using a blender of food processor.  Add sugar to the strawberry mixture and beat with a heavy spoon. A wooden spoon is suggested. Add the egg whites to a mixing bowl. Beat until soft peaks form. Add sugar syrup to the egg whites while the mixer is running.  Beat the egg white mixture at high speed until the egg white mixture is stiff. The egg white mixture will have stiff peaks when it is ready to have the strawberry puree added. Fold in the strawberry puree.  Fold in the whipped cream.  Cover the strawberry mixture with plastic wrap.  Refrigerate and serve.
